c74object.name: bach.backtick
c74object.digest: Backticks the first element of a text-format llll
c74object.description: Returns the text-format representation of the llll, with the first element preceded by a backtick if certains conditions are met.

inlet.digest: The llll whose contained data types will be reported

outlet.digest: All the attributes of all the objects connected to the second outlet
outlet.description: The incoming llll is returned in text format, with its first element preceded by a backtick in the standard cases, if it is one of the supplied arguments, or if it is an attribute of one of the objects the second outlet is connected to.

objarg.name: symbols
objarg.description: The symbols that have to be backticked if found at the first position of the incoming lllls.

method.name: bang
method.description: Returns the data types of the most recently received llll.

method.name: llll
method.digest: Return the llll in text format, with the first element backticked if requested.
method.description:
Returns the incoming llll in text format, with the first element backticked if one of the following conditions is met:
- The first element is one of Max's or bach's reserved symbols (int, float, list, null, nil), as with all the bach objects.
- The first element is a rational or a pitch, as with all the bach objects.
- The first element is one of the symbols provided as bach.backtick's arguments. - The first element is an attribute of one of the objects connected to the second outlet of bach.backtick.

attribute.name: autoattrs
attribute.description: When set to 1 (default), the attributes of all the objects connected to bach.backtick are considered symbols to be prepended by a backtick if encountered at the first position of the llll, in addition to the standard ones (int, float, list, null, nil) and the ones provided as the object's arguments.

entry.name: Inlet 1 (llll)
entry.description: The llll whose contained data types will be reported.

entry.name: Outlet 1 (llll)
entry.description: All the attributes of all the objects connected to the second outlet. The incoming llll is returned in text format, with its first element preceded by a backtick in the standard cases, if it is one of the supplied arguments, or if it is an attribute of one of the objects the second outlet is connected to.
